snippet: Experts in election law say there is no reason to think that the march toward deregulating election spending will stop with Wednesday’s ruling on overall donation limits.
abstract: Sweeping language and logic of Supreme Court decision on campaign finance may imperil other legal restrictions on money in politics; 5-to-4 decision strikes down limits on contributions by individuals to candidates and parties; experts in election law say there is no reason to think that march toward deregulating election spending will stop with ruling.
lead_paragraph: Experts in election law say there is no reason to think that the march toward deregulating election spending will stop with Wednesday’s ruling on overall donation limits.

headline.main: Ruling’s Breadth Hints That More Campaign Finance Dominoes May Fall
headline.print_headline: Ruling’s Breadth Hints That More Campaign Finance Dominoes May Fall

keywords.value: McCutcheon v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
